The day after they lost defenseman Vladimir Malakhov to free agency, the Devils signed one of their top prospects yesterday, the defenseman Josef Boumedienne, a native of Sweden and the team's seventh choice in the 1996 draft.
Lou Lamoriello thought so highly of the 6-foot-1-inch, 200-pound Boumedienne that he protected him in favor of several other talented players in the expansion draft last month.

''We're excited about signing a quality defenseman such as Josef Boumedienne,'' said Lamoriello, who refused to disclose details of the contract. ''He has played against top competition in Europe for the past four seasons and has experience on the international level,'' said Lamoriello, who did not seem to be upset about the loss of Malakhov.
The unrestricted free agent that Lamoriello wants to keep is Claude Lemieux.
